item.title: Meta extends its Ray-Ban smart glasses deal beyond 2030
item.description:
Meta and eyewear conglomerate EssilorLuxottica plan to work together on smart glasses “into the next decade.” The two announced a long-term agreement today to extend a partnership that started in 2019 and has yielded two generations of Ray-Ban smart glasses.

The collaboration has helped Meta make smart glasses that stand out for their style

So far, the collaboration has helped Meta make smart glasses that stand out for their style. It looks like Meta wants to keep that trend going with its next generations of frames. Aside from Ray-Ban, EssilorLuxottica also owns Oakley and has licensing agreements with luxury brands, including Versace, Prada, Chanel, and others.

“I’m excited about our long term roadmap ahead. We have the opportunity...

Continue reading…
item.dc:creator: Justine Calma

item.title: Epic Games Store — and Fortnite — now available on iPad in the EU
item.description:
Just a day after third-party app stores were officially allowed on the iPad in the European Union, Epic Games announced on X that the Epic Games Store can now be installed on iPadOS. However, you need to live in a EU country and have an Apple account registered for that country in order to install […]

item.title: The cybersecurity labor gap now stands at 4M+ open jobs — Intezer has raised $33M for AI tools to plug it
item.description:
Cybersecurity has one of the biggest and most urgent talent shortages in the tech industry. Malicious attacks are on the rise, and the techniques being used to worm into networks are growing ever more sophisticated. Yet, the World Economic Forum recently found that there are 4 million cybersecurity positions unfilled globally, and it expects that […]

item.title: Best Buy dropped its fall deals schedule and there's major October Prime Day competition
item.description: Ahead of Black Friday, Best Buy's 2024 fall sales events include an October Flash Sale on the exact dates of Prime Big Deal Days.

item.title: Take $30 off the Fitbit Google Ace and help your kids jump into action
item.description: As of Sept. 17, get the Fitbit Google Ace on sale for $199.95 at Amazon. That's $30 off its normal price and a discount of 13%.
